Title: Compensation & Classification Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the Executive Director, People, and receiving day to day work direction from the Compensation/Classification Advisors, the Compensation & Classification Analyst provides a variety of classification/compensation services in support and maintenance of internal/external compensation and classification records, systems and reporting requirements, contract administration including annual pay and performance adjustments, and the delivery of services to clients across Providence Health Care (PHC) such as assisting with the preparation and classification of job descriptions, organizational charts, and industry-related research activities. 
   Skills Practical knowledge of collective agreements, applicable employment legislation and regulations. 
    Ability to organize work of self, identifying and managing multiple and complex priorities, meet deadlines, and work under pressure with minimum supervision. 
    Excellent interpersonal, oral and written communication skills including business writing skills. 
    Demonstrated ability to effective use Microsoft Office Suite products such as Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook at an intermediate to advanced level. 
    Demonstrated use and understanding of HR information systems and applicant hiring systems. Knowledge of PeopleSoft HCM is an asset. 
    Demonstrated ability to use online communication tools such as Skype, Zoom, etc. 
    Ability to work effectively, independently and in collaboration with others. 
    Ability to deal with others effectively, at all levels of the organization. 
    Demonstrated ability to identify, analyze, and resolve problems. 
    Demonstrated ability to utilize a customer service approach to staff and clients. 
    Physical ability to perform the duties of the position. 
   
Education A level of education, training and experience equivalent to a Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources plus two (2) to three (3) years’ recent related human resources experience including working in a unionized environment, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Previous experience in compensation or benefits is preferred. 
   Duties Maintains and updates Compensation & Classification and Public and Industry Reporting databases such as the CJDD, CRP and LIGER including scanning, uploading, and indexing required documentation and updating/obsoleting of files and data and liaising with applicable agencies on systems changes and updates. 
   
 Functions as a super-user on Compensation & Compensation related systems, identifies and investigates data and system issues, provides systems advice and makes recommendations, develops reports and queries, and works within People Services and other departments to determine the root of the issue and to troubleshoot solutions. Identifies opportunities for service improvement, provides input on changes, drafts processes and guidelines documents, and participates in business process improvement. 
   
 Prepares individual employee contract renewal and reclassification letters for various PHC departments. Liaises with areas such Payroll, Records and Benefits, Recruitment and/or Finance to process, investigate or follow up on queries such as contract terms such as benefit entitlement, vacation accruals, pay adjustments, stipends, retroactive payments, positions numbers, job code updates, etc. 
   
 Assists with the annual processing of pay adjustments for unionized and non-contract staff including sending out appropriate notifications to staff or Managers, working with Sustainment and HR Data Analytics to update HR Connect and PeopleSoft systems, proofing documentation, and reviewing exception reports. Prepares costings of wage increases for review. 
   
 Conducts regular audits of job code table, job inventory, CJDD and other classification and compensation records to ensure accuracy and integrity of data. 
   
 Conducts assigned research on classification and compensation matters such as completion of industry surveys and preparation and distribution of internal surveys. Assists with the completion of costing spreadsheets and reports for grievance liability or pay changes for Finance, HEABC or other stakeholders. 
   
 Updates and maintains Compensation/Classification repositories of job descriptions, information directories, intranet site, and departmental filing systems. 
   
 Prepares job descriptions for specific/designated areas and classifications including conducting job audits if required, preparation of job description including review of qualifications, assignment of classification/evaluation for review by Compensation and Classification Advisor as required. Submits to Union or HEABC as appropriate. 
   
 Assists Compensation and Classification Advisors with responses to Union objections to job descriptions or HEABC queries, by researching appropriate response based on requirements of classification system, clarification of duties and requirements with applicable department/program, and reviewing interpretations and jurisprudence as necessary. 
   
 Provides support and participates in Compensation & Classification projects. Prepares and maintains project tracking documentation, training materials, statistical information and reports. 
   
 Participates in meetings, provides information, and takes action as appropriate. 
   
 Performs other related duties as assigned.

Title: SAP OTC Business Analyst
Description:
SAP OTC Business Analyst 

We are KIK! 
We create the products and brands that people trust to clean, sanitize, and protect their homes, pools, and cars . We are one of North America’s largest independent consumer product manufacturers with 20 North American manufacturing facilities . We also operate globally in Europe, Asia, UK, Australia, New Zealand, and South Africa . We are known by our portfolio of over 40 brands including Spic and Span® and Comet® cleaning products, Clorox® Pool&Spa ™ (under license), BioGuard®, and Natural Chemistry® pool chemicals, and Prestone ® and Holts® automotive performance chemicals . We are also the #1 producer in North America for store-brand (“private label”) bleach and a leading private label provider of laundry detergent and additives, dishwashing products, general purpose cleaning and other home care products . 
Our global team of over 2,500 employees drive our capabilities in product development, product formulation, strategic sourcing, manufacturing, packaging design, brand marketing, project management, quality assurance, compliance, distribution, and logistics . 
Our organization is constantly evolving and is driven by a set of “One KIK” values – a dedication to following through on commitments in a customer-focused, profit-motivated way; while never compromising on safety, ethics, or integrity . 
The SAP OTC Business Analyst will report to the Director, SAP. This "hands on" role will interface with KIK business areas, its managers and system users to define, design, implement, train, and provide on-going support. This position will work closely with an extended cross functional team of Business Analysts, Basis and Integration consultants who are subject matter experts in various modules of SAP and various other tools used within KIK. The incumbent will have subject matter expertise in one or more of the above-mentioned areas. This role will also assist, and coordinate aspects of on-going cross-functional projects as required. 

As an OTC Business Analyst , you will be responsible for the development, implementation, and on-going management of an integrated solutions strategy, while balancing relationship, KIK management expectations, with the goal to optimize operating costs, achieve savings while provide superior customer service through the development and deployment of solutions, using best practices and industry expertise to provide a solution that meets our requirements. 

Essential Job Functions 
• Understand key business needs and provide solutions with compelling value propositions that align with SAP capabilities 
• Deliver innovative business consulting, business process design, systems integration, and application design 
• Coordinate with internal and external resources to complete detailed design proposed solutions 
• Lead the development and documentation of the technical requirements and Application Design 
• Assist with developing the roadmap that integrates solutions across various businesses 
• Lead the identification and resolution of gaps and inconsistencies 
• Accountable for successful execution, as the solution is implemented and the solution transitions to regular operations. Accountable from startup phase until successful hand off to operations is completed 
• Provide guidance to the team through problem definition, issue identification and work plan development using problem solving principles and experience 
• Coach and mentor other team members and conduct knowledge sharing activities 
• Responsible for planning an approach for defining, documenting, categorizing, and packaging requirements for projects and initiatives 
• Liaise with business management, IT management, vendors and partners in project related matters as well as lead discussion on strategic direction and best fit alternatives or to align IT plans with Business strategic plans 
• Conduct meetings and data discovery sessions 
• Provide subject matter expertise for internal & external auditors, programmers, consultants, vendors and business analysts 
• Provide direction through leadership and decision making to team members/management in matters related to system products, design development strategy, estimates, options, alternative approaches, impacts of decisions, procedures, costs benefit analysis, cost effective solutions and critical paths for projects 
• Keep abreast of current trends, practices and technological developments related to the SAP OTC and related solutions 
• Interacting with internal teams to solicit system-level technical requirements and resolve technical issues 
• Advanced knowledge and ability to configure and support SAP OTC applications through use of SDLC practices and troubleshooting 
• Advanced ability to research and analyze current and new technologies to make recommendations that meet the changing needs of our business, assist in the development of business requirement documents templates, test scripts / test scenarios, business processes and procedures, work instructions, and other detailed user related and documentation to support standard configuration

• Ensures adherence to established change management processes

Title: Inventory control analyst / Analyste du contrôle des stocks
Description:
Analyste du contrôle des stocks
 Sous la supervision du responsable logistique, l'analyste du contrôle des stocks sera responsable de l'état globale et de la précision des stocks. C'est l'occasion, pour le candidat, de diriger la création et la mise en œuvre de contrôles, de procédures et de systèmes d'inventaire, ainsi que l'amélioration continue des processus. Il jouera un rôle transversal dans l'entreprise en travaillant en étroite collaboration avec les départements de fabrication, de production, de qualité, d'achat, de finances et de service à la clientèle. Le candidat idéal pour ce poste aura une solide compréhension de l'environnement de fabrication et des processus financiers associés ; une connaissance de la chaîne d'approvisionnement, de la réception, du flux des stocks, des processus d'exploitation et des principes de fabrication. Un intérêt pour les processus de fabrication de haute technologie, d'excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et, surtout, un esprit de service. Il sera le maître d'œuvre de tous les processus et projets liés à la gestion des stocks.
 Responsabilités générales

Faciliter les équipes interfonctionnelles dans le développement de nouvelles mesures, d'outils analytiques et de mécanismes de suivi pour une grande précision des stocks afin de permettre des examens opérationnels/financiers réguliers.
Examiner les rapprochements d'inventaire et l'analyse des flux liés aux pièces de fabrication, y compris les matières premières, les encours, les produits finis.
Résoudre tous les problèmes liés aux stocks alloués, aux problèmes de réception, à la mise en place des commandes, à la correspondance des factures.
Agir en tant que super-utilisateur pour la mise en œuvre de l'ERP (LN d'Infor).
Définir, coordonner et surveiller les programmes de comptage cyclique dans tous les entrepôts internes et externes. Contrôler et prendre les mesures appropriées en fonction des résultats des comptages de cycles.
Collaborer avec l'équipe de planification et d'achat afin de déterminer le flux de matériel et d'informations adapté pour contrôler et équilibrer les réceptions et le niveau d'inventaire avec les sous-traitants.
Collaborer de manière transversale, afin de répondre aux questions relatives à l'inventaire et aux processus opérationnels provenant de tous les départements.
Obtenir des politiques et procédures globales claires pour assurer un suivi précis des stocks et des niveaux d'inventaire appropriés, ainsi que le partage d'informations entre les parties prenantes (chaîne d'approvisionnement, production, ingénierie, qualité...) pour toutes les questions de logistique opérationnelle.
Elaborer la vision à moyen terme en termes d'occupation de l'espace avec les achats et la planification.
Participer à tous les projets d'amélioration continue pour la réduction des coûts liés aux opérations logistiques.
Mettre en place la bonne gestion de la documentation liée à la gestion des stocks (instructions de travail logistique, carte des processus, organigramme...)
Mettre en place et suivre les bons indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) pour suivre et contrôler l'exactitude des stocks.

Exigences

Baccalauréat en gestion des opérations/de la chaîne d'approvisionnement, génie industriel, comptabilité ou expériences professionnelles suffisantes
Minimum 2 ans d'expérience en comptabilité/opération/audit de fabrication avec une expérience pertinente du contrôle des stocks dans un environnement industriel à haut volume.
Bonne connaissance de la logistique et de la gestion allégée, une certification Lean Six Sigma est un atout.
Capacité à s'adapter facilement dans un secteur en pleine croissance avec un état d'esprit AGIL.
Connaissance avancée de l'ERP, en particulier de LN d'Infor.
Posséder la capacité d'exceller et de rester calme sous pression, de travailler avec un éventail de disciplines et de cultures différentes
Forte capacité à évaluer les situations problématiques afin d'en identifier les causes, de rassembler et de traiter les informations pertinentes, de générer des solutions possibles et de faire des recommandations et/ou de résoudre le problème.
Excellentes compétences en Excel et capacité à manipuler et à analyser de grandes quantités de données.
Faire preuve de compétences claires en matière de communication écrite et verbale
Une certification APiCS serait un plus 
Bilingue français/anglais

Avantages

Jouez un rôle essentiel dans la mise sur le marché des premiers véhicules électriques tout-terrain au monde.
Horaire de travail flexible et hybride
Événements de l'entreprise - barbecues, rafting, journées d'essai pour les employés, etc.

RPA - REER collectif

Collaborate cross functionally, to answer questions related to inventory and operational processes from all departments
Get clear global policies and procedures to ensure accurate tracking of inventory and appropriate inventory levels the information sharing between stakeholders (supply chain, production, engineering, quality…) for all operational logistics matters
Elaborate the mid term vision in term of space occupancy with procurement and planning
Involve in all the continuous improvement projects for cost reductions linked to logistics operation
Put in place the right documentation management linked to inventory management (logistics work instructions, processes map, flow chart…)
Set up and track the right KPI to track and monitor inventory accuracy

Bachelor in operation/supply chain management, industrial engineering, accounting or sufficient professional experiences
Minimum 2 years’ experience in Manufacturing accounting/operation/audit with relevant experience of inventory control in high volume manufacturing environment
Good knowledge in lean logistic and lean management, a Lean Six Sigma certification is an asset

Strong ability to assess problem situations to identify causes, gather and process relevant information, generate possible solutions, and make recommendations and/or resolve the problem

Demonstrate clear written and verbal communication skills

Title: OmniaBio: Business Systems Analyst, Quality & Compliance Systems
Company: Centre for Commercialization of Regenerative Medicine
Description:
About OmniaBio:
 OmniaBio Inc, a subsidiary of Toronto-based CCRM, is a contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO) producing gene-modified cell therapies and viral vectors, compliant with cGMP standards. The facility has support from the Government of Ontario, via the Invest Ontario Fund, and is the first project to be funded through the Life Sciences Strategy. The facility will be built in phases with the ultimate goal of building the largest facility of its kind in Canada (over 350,000 sq ft). OmniaBio is Canada’s first commercial-scale CDMO dedicated to cell and gene therapies. Located on the biomanufacturing campus at McMaster Innovation Park (Hamilton, ON), OmniaBio will catalyze life sciences careers and innovation in Canada while advancing pioneering medicine with the potential to cure, not just treat, many forms of cancer, cardiovascular diseases, Parkinson’s, and diabetes, amongst others. OmniaBio will support a broad range of cell and gene therapy companies globally, enabling pivotal/Phase III and commercial-scale manufacturing. OmniaBio will complete CCRM’s continuum of process development, clinical and commercial capabilities. CCRM is a leader in developing and commercializing regenerative medicine-based technologies, and cell and gene therapies. 


Role Summary:
 The Business Systems Analyst, Quality & Compliance Systems reports to the Project Manager, Manufacturing & Quality Systems. This position requires analytical and critical thinking skills and the ability to understand business processes and objectives. The role of the Quality & Compliance Business Systems Analyst is to elicit, analyze, specify and validate the business needs of project stakeholders in Quality and Process Development to assist with the various software and automation system selections, implementations and ongoing support and improvements. This includes interviewing stakeholders, and gathering and compiling user requirements, to convey to the technical teams throughout the software implementation life cycle. The Compliance Analyst will also apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to support the development process, and to ensure that project deliverables meet specifications. The Compliance Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring the IT team understands the business requirements. As well to ensure support, improvements and optimization of systems enhance business processes optimal performance. 


Responsibilities:
 Strategy and Planning 


Collaborate with project managers and project sponsors to determine project scope and vision.
Clearly identify project stakeholders and establish user classes, as well as their characteristics.
Conduct interviews to gather user requirements through workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Identify and establish the scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria and metrics.
Work with stakeholders and the project team to prioritize collected requirements.
Research, review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing data collection processes, and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.
 Acquisition and Deployment 


Assist in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed-upon requirements and to support the selection efforts.
Participate in the quality analysis of selected solutions to ensure that the features and functionalities have been enabled and optimized.
Participate in the installation and integration of new laboratory equipment into laboratory systems such as ELN, LIMS and data collection and management systems.
Participate in the creation of operational procedures and documentation for systems that the organization may opt to use.
 Operational Management 


Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility and conformity to standards.
Develop and utilize standard templates to write requirements specifications accurately and concisely.
Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to consultants, developers and the project team.
Where applicable, assist with developing prototypes of interfaces and attributes based on the user requirements.
Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Develop and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options, align with instrument vendor engineers, system consultants and support personnel, and communicate recommendations back to the business stakeholders.
Assist with installing, maintaining and troubleshooting of laboratory systems, and Quality and Compliance systems.
Respond quickly to unplanned events or challenges, such as the loss of communication between instruments and laboratory data collection systems.
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project or enhancement life cycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.
Communicate changes, enhancements and modifications of business requirements – verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, consultants, vendors and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Analyze day-to-day functions and processes of the system to ensure performance within predetermined guidelines, limits and specifications.
Identify and resolve application issues to maintain services, enhance capabilities, and prevent system outages.
Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in quality and compliance-related applications and laboratory systems across the organization.

Requirements:


5+ years’ experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification and methodology developent.
Previous experience in the gathering of requirements for the selection, implementation, and on-going support of Quality and Compliance Systems.
Thorough knowledge of laboratory operations processes.
Experience in supporting multiple laboratory software and hardware systems, preferably in a biotechnology or life sciences environment.
Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language.
Experience in business process mapping tools and techniques.
Understanding of business systems analysis, application development and software development life cycle concepts.
Working exposure to the design, development and implementation of software and laboratory data collections solutions.
Ability to work positively in a matrixed environment with Process Development, Quality, IT teams and vendor resources.
Experience in IT and Quality change control processes.
University degree in natural science, biological or chemical engineering, computer science or information technology.

Desired Characteristics:


Working experience with contract development and manufacturing organizations (CDMOs) is an asset.
Strong understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and Good Automated Manufacturing Practices (GAMP) standards, including the computer system validation process and data integrity for GxP systems, is preferred.
ITIL process experience is an asset.
Experience with cloud platforms is an asset.
Demonstrated leadership capabilities.
Ability to work independently and as a team player in a highly collaborative organization.
Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Reacts to project adjustments and alterations promptly and efficiently.
Flexible during times of change.
Ability to work and communicate with team members from a broad spectrum of disciplines.
Persuasive, encouraging and motivating.
Ability to elicit cooperation from a wide variety of sources, including upper management, clients and other departments.
Ability to bring projects to successful completion.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Excellent conflict management skills.
Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products.
Must be able to learn, understand and apply new technologies.

Le candidat idéal pour ce poste aura une solide compréhension de l'environnement de fabrication et des processus financiers associés ; une connaissance de la chaîne d'approvisionnement, de la réception, du flux des stocks, des processus d'exploitation et des principes de fabrication. Un intérêt pour les processus de fabrication de haute technologie, d'excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et, surtout, un esprit de service. Obtenir des politiques et procédures globales claires pour assurer un suivi précis des stocks et des niveaux d'inventaire appropriés, ainsi que le partage d'informations entre les parties prenantes (chaîne d'approvisionnement, production, ingénierie, qualité...) pour toutes les questions de logistique opérationnelle.
Elaborer la vision à moyen terme en termes d'occupation de l'espace avec les achats et la planification.
Participer à tous les projets d'amélioration continue pour la réduction des coûts liés aux opérations logistiques.

Un intérêt pour les processus de fabrication de haute technologie, d'excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et, surtout, un esprit de service. Il sera le maître d'œuvre de tous les processus et projets liés à la gestion des stocks.

Résoudre tous les problèmes liés aux stocks alloués, aux problèmes de réception, à la mise en place des commandes, à la correspondance des factures.

Forte capacité à évaluer les situations problématiques afin d'en identifier les causes, de rassembler et de traiter les informations pertinentes, de générer des solutions possibles et de faire des recommandations et/ou de résoudre le problème.

Il jouera un rôle transversal dans l'entreprise en travaillant en étroite collaboration avec les départements de fabrication, de production, de qualité, d'achat, de finances et de service à la clientèle. Le candidat idéal pour ce poste aura une solide compréhension de l'environnement de fabrication et des processus financiers associés ; une connaissance de la chaîne d'approvisionnement, de la réception, du flux des stocks, des processus d'exploitation et des principes de fabrication. Un intérêt pour les processus de fabrication de haute technologie, d'excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et, surtout, un esprit de service. Il sera le maître d'œuvre de tous les processus et projets liés à la gestion des stocks.
 Responsabilités générales

Faciliter les équipes interfonctionnelles dans le développement de nouvelles mesures, d'outils analytiques et de mécanismes de suivi pour une grande précision des stocks afin de permettre des examens opérationnels/financiers réguliers.
Examiner les rapprochements d'inventaire et l'analyse des flux liés aux pièces de fabrication, y compris les matières premières, les encours, les produits finis.
Résoudre tous les problèmes liés aux stocks alloués, aux problèmes de réception, à la mise en place des commandes, à la correspondance des factures.
Agir en tant que super-utilisateur pour la mise en œuvre de l'ERP (LN d'Infor).
Définir, coordonner et surveiller les programmes de comptage cyclique dans tous les entrepôts internes et externes. Contrôler et prendre les mesures appropriées en fonction des résultats des comptages de cycles.

Collaborer de manière transversale, afin de répondre aux questions relatives à l'inventaire et aux processus opérationnels provenant de tous les départements.
Obtenir des politiques et procédures globales claires pour assurer un suivi précis des stocks et des niveaux d'inventaire appropriés, ainsi que le partage d'informations entre les parties prenantes (chaîne d'approvisionnement, production, ingénierie, qualité...) pour toutes les questions de logistique opérationnelle.
Elaborer la vision à moyen terme en termes d'occupation de l'espace avec les achats et la planification.
Participer à tous les projets d'amélioration continue pour la réduction des coûts liés aux opérations logistiques.
Mettre en place la bonne gestion de la documentation liée à la gestion des stocks (instructions de travail logistique, carte des processus, organigramme...)
Mettre en place et suivre les bons indicateurs clés de performance (KPI) pour suivre et contrôler l'exactitude des stocks.

Baccalauréat en gestion des opérations/de la chaîne d'approvisionnement, génie industriel, comptabilité ou expériences professionnelles suffisantes
Minimum 2 ans d'expérience en comptabilité/opération/audit de fabrication avec une expérience pertinente du contrôle des stocks dans un environnement industriel à haut volume.
Bonne connaissance de la logistique et de la gestion allégée, une certification Lean Six Sigma est un atout.
Capacité à s'adapter facilement dans un secteur en pleine croissance avec un état d'esprit AGIL.
Connaissance avancée de l'ERP, en particulier de LN d'Infor.
Posséder la capacité d'exceller et de rester calme sous pression, de travailler avec un éventail de disciplines et de cultures différentes
Forte capacité à évaluer les situations problématiques afin d'en identifier les causes, de rassembler et de traiter les informations pertinentes, de générer des solutions possibles et de faire des recommandations et/ou de résoudre le problème.
Excellentes compétences en Excel et capacité à manipuler et à analyser de grandes quantités de données.
Faire preuve de compétences claires en matière de communication écrite et verbale

How do you know if you are a fit?

VistaVu has an exciting opportunity to recruit a highly process-oriented Business Analyst who is passionate about providing digital transformation and implementation services, on a one-year contract.
This Business Analyst role is project-driven and will be a key member of a project team that implements internal enterprise application software projects (e.g. Business Software Systems, Integrations, Automations) which have cross-organization impact.
The Business Analyst will contribute to all phases of the project including requirements, analysis, implementation, testing, training, release and support.
In addition, the Business Analyst will be critical to ensuring that solutions implemented meet the business’ requirements with high quality and high user adoption.
As a remote first work environment, this position is open to anyone in Canada with a preference for those located in Calgary or in the local area. If you are in Calgary, you are welcome to work out of our downtown office!

BUSINESS ANALYSIS – Work closely with business users and project team to implement enterprise application software projects which have cross-organization impact, as well as smaller projects; requirements gathering and analysis (e.g. business, user, process, system, data, integration); understand problem to be solved; propose options; implements solutions; business process consulting; facilitate workshops and meetings; creation of functional specification and technical specification documents; contribute to project documentation; serve as a functional subject matter expert for the project team; ensure that all projects delivered meet the business’ requirements with high quality and high user adoption.

USER TRAINING – Plan and lead the delivery of end-user training to business users; deliver end-user training to business users; create and maintain training materials as needed.
GO-LIVE – plan and lead business users and project team to release the solution into production; conduct post-release verification testing.
USER SUPPORT – Plan and lead the delivery of end-user support; perform issue troubleshooting and resolution; perform root cause analysis and elimination; create and maintain support materials as needed.

5-7+ years experience
Completed post-secondary diploma or degree in Business, Finance, Economics, Marketing, Psychology, Communications, Information Technology, or Computer Science.
Business Analysis certification (e.g. https://www.iiba.org/), an equivalent alternative designation, or demonstrable progress towards such certification is desirable.

Business Analysis of projects that implemented: 

Enterprise application software (e.g. Sales, Marketing, Professional Services, Customer Service, Customer Success, Customer Experience, HR, Accounting, Finance).
Integrations (e.g. master data, transactional data, analytical data) for enterprise application software.
Cloud-based / SaaS software and technologies for companies with at least 300 employees.
Proficient working with technology, software, data, technical subjects.
SAP Business ByDesign experience is highly desirable (or comparable ERP).
Professional Services Industry experience is desirable.

What skills we value?

RESULTS-DRIVEN – Is self-starting; goal oriented; works with high pace; likes to win.
PROBLEM SOLVER – Sees opportunities, operates a with positive “can do” attitude.
PROCESS-ORIENTED – Thinks in terms of: processes and steps; inputs and outputs; customers and suppliers; “value add” and “no value add” activities; eliminating waste; increasing consistency.
CRITICAL THINKER – Thinks end-to-end; ensures we’re solving the right problem; gathers input and evidence; evaluates options; considers implications; tests assumptions; implements whole and practical solutions.
TECH SAVVY – In tune with business technology trends; capable working with enterprise application software (e.g. Sales, Marketing, Professional Services, Customer Service, Customer Success, Customer Experience, HR, Accounting, Finance); capable using team-based project work management tools (e.g. Teamwork, Smartsheet, Asana, Monday.com, etc); proficient working in remote work settings.
GOOD COMMUNICATOR – Communicates simply and clearly; communicates well verbally, written and visually; able to communicate complex processes/flows in a simple manner; comfortable making presentations.
OWNERSHIP – You take pride in your work; you hold yourself accountable; you want to work with a team that operates this way too.
COMFORTABLE WITH UNCERTAINTY – Is excited by uncharted territory; anticipates what might lie ahead; adapts easily to change.

What's in it for you?

Work in an environment where we base day-to-day operations on our 6 Core Values.
Work with one of the top SAP partners in North America.
Gain valuable experience with diversified industries like Field Services & Rentals, Manufacturing and Wholesale Distribution.
Expand your current skillset and knowledge with a growing Software & Technology company.

Title: OmniaBio: Business Systems Analyst, Quality & Compliance Systems
Company: Centre for Commercialization of Regenerative Medicine
Description:
About OmniaBio:
 OmniaBio Inc, a subsidiary of Toronto-based CCRM, is a contract development and manufacturing organization (CDMO) producing gene-modified cell therapies and viral vectors, compliant with cGMP standards. The facility has support from the Government of Ontario, via the Invest Ontario Fund, and is the first project to be funded through the Life Sciences Strategy. The facility will be built in phases with the ultimate goal of building the largest facility of its kind in Canada (over 350,000 sq ft). OmniaBio is Canada’s first commercial-scale CDMO dedicated to cell and gene therapies. Located on the biomanufacturing campus at McMaster Innovation Park (Hamilton, ON), OmniaBio will catalyze life sciences careers and innovation in Canada while advancing pioneering medicine with the potential to cure, not just treat, many forms of cancer, cardiovascular diseases, Parkinson’s, and diabetes, amongst others. OmniaBio will support a broad range of cell and gene therapy companies globally, enabling pivotal/Phase III and commercial-scale manufacturing. OmniaBio will complete CCRM’s continuum of process development, clinical and commercial capabilities. CCRM is a leader in developing and commercializing regenerative medicine-based technologies, and cell and gene therapies. 


Role Summary:
 The Business Systems Analyst, Quality & Compliance Systems reports to the Project Manager, Manufacturing & Quality Systems. This position requires analytical and critical thinking skills and the ability to understand business processes and objectives. The role of the Quality & Compliance Business Systems Analyst is to elicit, analyze, specify and validate the business needs of project stakeholders in Quality and Process Development to assist with the various software and automation system selections, implementations and ongoing support and improvements. This includes interviewing stakeholders, and gathering and compiling user requirements, to convey to the technical teams throughout the software implementation life cycle. The Compliance Analyst will also apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to support the development process, and to ensure that project deliverables meet specifications. The Compliance Analyst will play a pivotal role in ensuring the IT team understands the business requirements. As well to ensure support, improvements and optimization of systems enhance business processes optimal performance. 


Responsibilities:
 Strategy and Planning 


Collaborate with project managers and project sponsors to determine project scope and vision.
Clearly identify project stakeholders and establish user classes, as well as their characteristics.
Conduct interviews to gather user requirements through workshops, questionnaires, surveys, site visits, workflow storyboards, use cases, scenarios, and other methods.
Identify and establish the scope and parameters of requirements analysis on a project-by-project basis to define project impact, outcome criteria and metrics.
Work with stakeholders and the project team to prioritize collected requirements.
Research, review and analyze the effectiveness and efficiency of existing data collection processes, and develop strategies for enhancing or further leveraging these processes.
 Acquisition and Deployment 


Assist in conducting research on software and hardware products to meet agreed-upon requirements and to support the selection efforts.
Participate in the quality analysis of selected solutions to ensure that the features and functionalities have been enabled and optimized.
Participate in the installation and integration of new laboratory equipment into laboratory systems such as ELN, LIMS and data collection and management systems.
Participate in the creation of operational procedures and documentation for systems that the organization may opt to use.
 Operational Management 


Analyze and verify requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility and conformity to standards.
Develop and utilize standard templates to write requirements specifications accurately and concisely.
Translate conceptual user requirements into functional requirements in a clear manner that is comprehensible to consultants, developers and the project team.
Where applicable, assist with developing prototypes of interfaces and attributes based on the user requirements.
Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team.
Develop and conduct peer reviews of the business requirements to ensure that requirement specifications are correctly interpreted.
Assist with the interpretation of user requirements into feasible options, align with instrument vendor engineers, system consultants and support personnel, and communicate recommendations back to the business stakeholders.
Assist with installing, maintaining and troubleshooting of laboratory systems, and Quality and Compliance systems.
Respond quickly to unplanned events or challenges, such as the loss of communication between instruments and laboratory data collection systems.
Manage and track the status of requirements throughout the project or enhancement life cycle; enforce and redefine as necessary.
Communicate changes, enhancements and modifications of business requirements – verbally or through written documentation – to project managers, sponsors, consultants, vendors and other stakeholders so that issues and solutions are understood.
Analyze day-to-day functions and processes of the system to ensure performance within predetermined guidelines, limits and specifications.
Identify and resolve application issues to maintain services, enhance capabilities, and prevent system outages.
Prepare and deliver reports, recommendations, or alternatives that address existing and potential trouble areas in quality and compliance-related applications and laboratory systems across the organization.

Requirements:


5+ years’ experience with business and technical requirements analysis, elicitation, modeling, verification and methodology developent.
Previous experience in the gathering of requirements for the selection, implementation, and on-going support of Quality and Compliance Systems.
Thorough knowledge of laboratory operations processes.
Experience in supporting multiple laboratory software and hardware systems, preferably in a biotechnology or life sciences environment.
Ability to create systematic and consistent requirements specifications in both technical and user-friendly language.
Experience in business process mapping tools and techniques.
Understanding of business systems analysis, application development and software development life cycle concepts.
Working exposure to the design, development and implementation of software and laboratory data collections solutions.
Ability to work positively in a matrixed environment with Process Development, Quality, IT teams and vendor resources.
Experience in IT and Quality change control processes.
University degree in natural science, biological or chemical engineering, computer science or information technology.

Desired Characteristics:


Working experience with contract development and manufacturing organizations (CDMOs) is an asset.
Strong understanding of Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP) and Good Automated Manufacturing Practices (GAMP) standards, including the computer system validation process and data integrity for GxP systems, is preferred.
ITIL process experience is an asset.
Experience with cloud platforms is an asset.
Demonstrated leadership capabilities.
Ability to work independently and as a team player in a highly collaborative organization.
Can conform to shifting priorities, demands and timelines through analytical and problem-solving capabilities.
Reacts to project adjustments and alterations promptly and efficiently.
Flexible during times of change.
Ability to work and communicate with team members from a broad spectrum of disciplines.
Persuasive, encouraging and motivating.
Ability to elicit cooperation from a wide variety of sources, including upper management, clients and other departments.
Ability to bring projects to successful completion.
Strong written and oral communication skills.
Excellent conflict management skills.
Adept at conducting research into project-related issues and products.
Must be able to learn, understand and apply new technologies.
 OmniaBio Inc. is a developing organization and represents a fluid working environment. Flexibility and adaptability are essential, and duties will be influenced by the needs of the organization. 

 Applicants must be legally eligible to work in Canada. 

 OmniaBio Inc. is committed to accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process, providing the applicant has met the bona fide requirements for the open position.
